Authors:
Thaís Garcia da Silva, Lenka Stenclova, Naiara Carolina
Pereira Archanjo, Inessa Lacativa Bagatini
Title:
Review and phylogenetic position of genus Nephrocytium Nägeli
(Sphaeropleales, Chlorophyceae), with description of Nephrocytiaceae
fam. nov. and Nephrocytium vieirae sp. nov.
Keywords:
18S rRNA; coccoid; Oocystaceae; tufA; taxonomic
revision.
Abstract:
Commonly known planktonic green algal genus Nephrocytium
was in traditional way assumed to have a close relationship with the
genus Oocystis and consequently have been included inside the
Oocystaceae family. Its classification inside the family differed in
some authors, nevertheless, its position inside the family was not
questioned. Previous molecular studies assigned Oocystaceae to
Trebouxiophyceae and surprisingly some of the former Oocystaceae members
- e.g. crescent Nephrochlamys and also Nephrocytium, outside the family,
to Chlorophyceae. These studies suggested placement of Nephrocytium
inside the order Sphaeropleales with unclear position inside (incertae
sedis). Novel placement is in agreement with strong morphological trait
- the ultrastructure of the cell wall, which differ of the oocystaceaen
multilayered cell wall. Present study aims to get enough data to
establish for Nephrocytium separated family and provide new insights to
the species concept of genus, including the description of Nephrocytium
vierae spec. nova.
